result.execSummary:
The defendant Lataurean J Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees and assessments including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance upon shall be due no later than 3/1/2018.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit for 30 days, 4/16/2015 to 4/21/2015 and 2/9/16 to 3/4/2016.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Comply with all child support Court orders.

Fine is set at zero.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.    DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Court advised the defendant that under Wisconsin Statutes 302.113, the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendant could serve the entire bifucated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit for 30 days, 4/16/2015 to 4/21/2015 and 2/9/2016 to 3/4/2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lataurean J Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Determination of Eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program 302.05(3), received and filed. LNR
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion for WSAP eligibility.

Defendant Lataurean J Brown in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Defendant Lataurean J Brown in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 30 days (04-16-2015 to 04-21-2015 and 02-09-2016 to 03-04-2016) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 30 days (04-16-2015 to 04-21-2015 and 02-09-2016 to 03-04-2016) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon shall be due no later than 03-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders..
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting; Notice & Acknowledgement; 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 03-03-2016 received and filed.

Defendant Lataurean J Brown in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record.

As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Case set for sentencing on 3/4/2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Off the record discussion. Defense request an adjournment. No motions filed. Court addresses the Justice Point received and notes Defendant continues to comply. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lataurean J Brown in court with attorney Christina Balistreri for Mark A. Pecora.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Defendant informed the court that his family will be hiring another attorney. Defendant Defendant ordered to report to State Public Defender's office and to return immediately to court or a warrant will be issued for his arrest. Case passed.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.
